Name: Fragment of a pottery coffin
Description: Upper section from the lid of a pottery coffin, with modelled decoration to show human head and, from the centre of the head, downturned arms (figure's right arm only survives). The eyes, eyelids and nose, and the mouth are raised, with perforation for the eyes and mouth. A number of schematic images were found on coffins in the area of the Abydos temple, dated by the excavator, Petrie, to the Roman Period, and identified as the coffins of children.
